query: I'm experiencing domestic abuse in cambridgeshire and need to leave with my children. What emergency social care and housing support can I access?

retrieved_documents.content:
[Page 4]
 
 
4 | Cambridgeshire County Council – Looking after someone Adult Social Care - Easy Read | Ma rch 2025  
 Pictures  Words  
 
 
 You can find lots more support on our council 
webpages : www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk  
 If you have an accident or become ill, you may not 
be able to help the person you look after.  
 
 
 
 You can register for the What If?  Service.  The 
service can help in emergencies.  
You can find out more at : 
 
https://www.caringtogether.org/support -for-
carers/adult -carers/whatifplan/  
 
 If you need a bit more help, you might be able to get 
some help from the council.  
The council can give you information and advice. 
You can also ask the council for a Carers 
Assessment .

[Page 1]
 
1 | Cambridgeshire County Council – Assessment and eligibility  | July 2024  
  
  
Assessment and Eligibility for Adult 
Social Care services  
Many people are able to stay independent, safe,  and well without 
needing support from Adult Social Care. We recommend that you 
explore options such as equipment and technology and community help, first. 
You can find out lots of information on the council’s website at www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk/residents/adults/organising- care- and-
support  
 
 
If you have tried other ways to stay independent and still need further 
support, the first step is to contact the council for a conversation.  
Contact details are at the end of this information sheet.  
 
We may suggest that you have a S ocial Care Assessment. This 
assessment looks at your strengths and your needs and identifies what 
support you may require . 
This includes giving information and advice to help you remain 
independent for as long as possible, and care and support for those

[Page 1]
 
1 | Cambridgeshire County Council – Assessment and eligibility  | July 2024  
  
  
Assessment and Eligibility for Adult 
Social Care services  
Many people are able to stay independent, safe,  and well without 
needing support from Adult Social Care. We recommend that you 
explore options such as equipment and technology and community help, first.

support  
 
 
If you have tried other ways to stay independent and still need further

assessment looks at your strengths and your needs and identifies what 
support you may require . 
This includes giving information and advice to help you remain 
independent for as long as possible, and care and support for those

There are services across Cambridgeshire which support people when they are in need of urgent help. Make contact today. Mental health crisis If you or someone you know, is thinking of hurting themselves, has made threats to hurt you or someone else, and is feeling distress that seems overwhelming or suicide seems the only option: there are many organisations that can help with these feelings. Contact the NHS First Response Service for mental health support for yourself, or on behalf of someone else. D ial 111 and select option 2. The phone line is available 24 hours a day. For more general information on support around mental health in Cambridgeshire, go to the Keep Your Head website . Domestic abuse Information about domestic abuse is available from Cambridgeshire and Peterborough Domestic Violence Partnership . There is also support for domestic abuse on the Cambridgeshire Constabulary website

[Page 8]
 
 
8 | Cambridgeshire County Council – If you need care and support when you leave hospital  - Easy Read | 
August 2024 
 Reablement  
Pictures  Words  
 You could ask for some help from the Reablement 
Team.  
 
They can help you do the things you used to be able to do.  
 You can contact Reablement  
Cambridgeshire County Council  
Web: www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk  
Email: careinfo@cambridgeshire.gov.uk  
 
Care and support at home  
Pictures  Words  
 If you need help for a longer time, you might need a 
social care assessment . 
 A social care assessment  looks at what you are 
good at, and what you might need some help with.

[Page 8]
 
 
8 | Cambridgeshire County Council – If you need care and support when you leave hospital  - Easy Read | 
August 2024

Pictures  Words

Email: careinfo@cambridgeshire.gov.uk

 If you need help for a longer time, you might need a 
social care assessment . 
 A social care assessment  looks at what you are 
good at, and what you might need some help with.

Independent, safe and well There is a wide range of care and support providers throughout Cambridgeshire. Most people who contact us with concerns about needing residential care are able to remain safe, well and independent through other support. Find out more about types of care and support and how you can organise it. If you are unsure which council you need to contact, you can find your local council on the GOV.UK website . Information about paying for care Mental health and wellbeing, including dementia Worried about a friend or family member? Adult social care There is more information about adult social care on our webpage about social care needs assessment . Organising adult social care if you are moving into Cambridgeshire The Local Authority where you usually live will organise care for a temporary move to Cambridgeshire. If you are moving permanently we can only accept a referral to adult social care when you are registered with a GP in Cambridgeshire. If you have not moved yet

3 | Cambridgeshire County Council – If you need care and support when you leave hospital  - Easy Read | 
August 2024 
 Pictures  Words  
 There are also organisations that can help you if you 
have care and support needs. 
 You can find some information in this document.  
 
 
 Care Network  offer a free Help at Home Service for 
up to six weeks.  
 
In Cambridge, South Cambs and East Cambs you 
can call 01223 714433 or email hah.south@care-
network.org.uk  
 In Huntingdonshire and Fenland, you can call 01354 694413 or email hah.north@care -network.org.uk
 
 
 
 Care Network also have Community Navigators . 
Community Navigators  can help you to find the 
information you need about support and activities.  
 They can also suggest other organisations which can help you.  
You can find out more on www.care -network.org.uk

[Page 4]
 
4 | Cambridgeshire County Council –  What happens if you need care and support when you leave 
hospital ? | August  2024  
 and complete the questionnaire to help identify things that might help 
you, or telephone 01480 415719.  
 
Reablement Service  
The council’s Reablement Team can support you to maximise your independence by helping you learn or regain the skills needed for 
everyday life.  
 
You can find out more at  www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk search for ‘short 
term care’ . 
 
Care and support at home   
If you have longer term care and support needs, we may suggest that 
you have a social care needs assessment.   A social care needs 
assessment looks at your strengths and your needs and identifies what 
support you may require and how much you need to pay for your care.   
If you need support with personal care, such as washing yourself or getting dressed, you can receive care and support at home. A carer will 
visit you to help with activities of daily living such as getting up in the

answer:
If you are experiencing domestic abuse in Cambridgeshire and need to leave with your children, there are several resources and support services available to you.

**Summary:** You can access support for domestic abuse through the Cambridgeshire and Peterborough Domestic Violence Partnership and the Cambridgeshire Constabulary website. For immediate help, contact these organizations.

**Details and Next Steps:**
- **Domestic Abuse Support:** Visit the Cambridgeshire and Peterborough Domestic Violence Partnership for information and support. The Cambridgeshire Constabulary website also provides resources for those experiencing domestic abuse.
- **Emergency Housing and Social Care:** While specific emergency housing options are not detailed in the documents, contacting Cambridgeshire County Council for a social care assessment could help identify your needs and the support available. You can find more information on their website: [Cambridgeshire County Council](https://www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk).
- **Contact Information:** For urgent support, you can reach out to local services through the council's website or by contacting the Care Network, which offers assistance and can guide you to appropriate resources.

For more detailed assistance and to explore your options, it is recommended to contact local services directly through the provided links and contact numbers.

test_metadata.prompt_template:
Please answer the following question about social care services in UK local authorities based only on the information in the provided documents.

Question: {query}

Context from relevant documents:
{context}

Instructions:
1. Provide a clear, direct answer that would help someone needing this information. If information isn't available, state: "The available documents don't provide specific information about [aspect]."

2. Synthesize information from ALL relevant documents to provide the most complete answer rather than analyzing documents individually.

3. Structure your response with:
   - A concise 1-2 sentence summary first
   - Relevant details organized in short, clear paragraphs
   - Bullet points for lists or step-by-step information
   - Bold text for key information the user should notice

4. For financial information:
   - Include exact figures, time periods, and what the funding covers
   - Present financial data clearly: "The adult social care budget is **£X million** for [time period]"

5. Always include practical next steps or resources:
   - Provide contact information, URLs, or application methods mentioned in the documents
   - Suggest where the person could find more information

6. When citing sources, use a simple format: "According to [document name/description]" or include URLs where available.

Answer:
